image.caption: Image courtesy of the U.S. House of Representatives Photography Office

profileText: A Representative from Colorado; born in Greeley, Weld County, Colo., January 27, 1949; B.A., Colorado State University, 1972; businesswoman; teacher; member of the Fort Morgan, Colo., school board, 1990-1994; member of the Colorado state house of representatives, 1994-1998; member of the Colorado state senate, 1998-2002; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eighth and to the two succeeding Congress (January 3, 2003-January 3, 2009); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: "Marilyn N. Musgrave" in Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing Office, 2006.
